fields.description:
The new icons are hard to perceive in v1.8 due to lack of contrast ==> Gray line + black fonts on gray background.

I'd appreciate if things where more readable in future updates
fields.summary: Hard perceptible icons on Win 7 (classic UI)

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*:

Create a branch from a project (Branch created via 'Create branch' in Jira Ticket)

'Check out in SourceTree' in BitBucket

SourceTree tries to open but crashes and asks if I want to Debug
fields.summary: Branches from BitBucket crashes SourceTree

fields.description: simply updated from 1.7.x to 1.8
fields.summary: Crash on StartUp after update to 1.8

fields.description: I tried to uninstall Sourcetree 1.8.0.36401 with the windows "programs and features" (in control panel). It claimed to work, but when I tried to install Sourcetree 1.6.25 it told me that a more recent version is already installed (also after a reboot).
fields.summary: I cannot uninstall Sourcetree and install an older version

fields.description:
Tried to push a branch in a git repo.

Right clicked on branch name in left sidebar and selected "Push to origin/branch_name (tracked)".

Clicked on Ok in the dialogue box that poped up.

SourceTree crashed.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed when trying to push a branch

fields.description: I just installed SourceTree version 1.8. But I am currently unable to stage a file for commit. Please see the sourcetree.log file attached.
fields.summary: When staging a file, SourceTree crashes

fields.summary: Can't open source tree after instalation of 1.8 version.

fields.description:
There are no spaces between the repositories, what makes them hard to distinguish and to read. Additionally, the tabs are very ugly on Windows.

 !2016-02-16_093053.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Missing spaces, ugly user interface

fields.description: I mean really? I thought this product could not become worse but yeah, well done, you did it. Do you even have designers left on the project?
fields.summary: New UI is a huge clusterfuck

fields.description: When we try to stage a file in the Log/History view - source tree crashes!  this is repro for 100%
fields.summary: Crash when stage from log/history view

fields.description:
SourceTree crashes after I tried to downgrade from 1.8 because the UI of 1.7 lacks spaces between repositories, it's hard to read and in my opinion the UI is ugly in many aspects, eg. the tabs on Windows:
 !2016-02-16_094547.png|thumbnail! 

I downgraded as follows:
* Uninstalled SourceTree 1.8
* Renamed AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree to something else
* Downloaded and installed 1.7.0.32509 from
https://downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/SourceTreeSetup_1.7.0.32509.exe
* Application crashes every time

{noformat}
ERROR [2016-02-16 09:55:25,670] [1] [SourceTree.Accounts.AccountManager] [.ctor] - Unable to load accounts

fields.summary: Crash after downgrade to 1.7 (because of ugly UI in 1.8)

fields.description: accessing git flow through the menu is quite a hassle, also there's no way to edit the icon-bar?
fields.summary: where did the "git flow" icon go?

fields.summary: Crash while trying to push/open repository with submodules

fields.description: After updating from version 1.7, OpenSSH no longer works and gives a null reference exception.
fields.summary: OpenSSH no longer works in SourceTree 1.8

fields.description:
After the update to get the last source tree version, i got an error bug. The bug doesn't allow me to load source tree. 
I tried to relaunch source tree and it work. 
The log ressources are : 

2016-02-16T10:00:00: Called GetRepositoryHandler with unsupported RepoType [None]
fields.summary: Problem at the first launch

fields.description:
after updating to 1.8.0.36401, I can't start a new feature or release any more

the output just says:
"sh.exe C:\Users\(...)\Atlassian\SourceTree\gitflow_local\gitflow\git-flow release start 1.6.11
Completed with errors, see above."

(this is using the git flow-menu, it seems to work using the console)
fields.summary: can't start  feature/release
crash when select single file from staged file or unstaged file

fields.description:
If I try to start sourcetree after the newest update the UI is shown, but it crashes or freezes if I try to interact with the UI.

BTW: Why is the version listed as "unreleased"?
fields.summary: Sourctree doesn't work any more

fields.description:
SourceTree crashes after staging a arbritrary file. See screenshot and log file.

*Workaround 1.*
Update to v1.8.1

*Workaround 2.* 
Stage/Unstage from the File Status/Working Copy view.
fields.summary: SourceTree 1.8 crashes after staging a file

fields.description:
Stage a file in GIT, sourcetree crashes.

On commandline, git add $file works.

We are using git repos over ssh.
fields.summary: fatal: I don't handle protocol ' ssh'

fields.description: After upgrading to the latest version (1.8.0.36401) I cannot commit changes anymore. When trying to check the file I want to commit an Oops message appears which says SourceTree just crashed. I get the same error when double clicking a file in the same dialog area I previously comitted.
fields.summary: Crash trying to Commit changes

fields.description:
When I try to see file changes and choose minified file (f.e. min.css) the application stops working and dialog with "SourceTree has stopped working" text is shown.
I updated to current version with SourceTree auto update option.
fields.summary: Crash after choosing minified file (min.css)

fields.description: Приложение падает при загрузке
fields.summary: Crash application at start
Source Tree 1.8.0.36401 Crash when starting

fields.description: Please allow fitering/quick searching in the branch list.
fields.summary: Allow filtering branches
Crushed on start

fields.description:
GitFlow throws an error if i want to add a new feature!
>> Complete GitFlow Feature is not working after update to SourceTree-1.8.0.36401
fields.summary: GitFlow crashed

fields.description: Open a repository and then double click on a submodule to open it in a new tab. Switch focus from SourceTree to another application and back. When restoring focus all submodule tabs get closes.
fields.summary: Submodule tabs get closed when SourceTree window focus is restored

fields.description: Application chashed after click button "push" but before pushing data. All time crashes
fields.summary: Crash after pushing

fields.description:
Give the option to use the previous interface and icons. The latest interface is quite messy and harder to understand. 

Some icons have disappeared, as git flow options.
The tabs are harder to distinguish.
The icons are much less intuitive.
fields.summary: Change User Interface

fields.description:
I created a custom action 
 !customaction1.png! 

I can see it from the Actions menu
 !customaction2.png! 

It is not available from context menu
 !customaction3.png!
fields.summary: Custom Actions does not work from Context Menu

fields.description: It would be nice to have an easy way to manage multiple SSH keys so that they are tied to a specific remote.  When setting up hosts, I should be able to create a host and choose to either use a password or SSH key.
fields.summary: Easy way to manage multiple SSH keys

fields.description:
As of today, only supported hosting providers are Bitbucket, GitHub and Stash. 

GitLab si an increasingly popular new hosting provider and would be great to have extended integration with it from SourceTree as well.
fields.summary: Add GitLab as Hosted Repository Service

fields.description:
Every time I click on a .js file in the working view I hit a crash. Below is the callstack:

000000d2`6e8fcb10 00007ff8`bbde5f15 mlang!CScore::operator<+0x3a 
01 000000d2`6e8fcb40 00007ff8`cd86fae2 mlang!_compareScores+0x15
02 000000d2`6e8fcb70 00007ff8`cd86f827 msvcrt!shortsort+0x62 
03 000000d2`6e8fcbb0 00007ff8`bbdd6643 msvcrt!qsort+0xc7 
04 (Inline Function) --------`-------- mlang!CScores::SortByScore+0x35 
05 000000d2`6e8fd020 00007ff8`bbdd4d6c mlang!LCDetect::DetectA+0x313 
06 (Inline Function) --------`-------- mlang!LCD_Detect+0x17 
07 000000d2`6e8fd760 00007ff8`bbdd4bc2 mlang!_DetectInputCodepage+0x13c 
08 000000d2`6e8fd860 00007ff8`5dc77a52 mlang!CMultiLanguage2::DetectInputCodepage+0x32 
09 000000d2`6e8fd8a0 00007ff8`5dc777d5 SourceTree!DomainBoundILStubClass.IL_STUB_CLRtoCOM(MultiLanguage.MLDETECTCP, UInt32, Byte ByRef, Int32 ByRef, MultiLanguage.DetectEncodingInfo ByRef, Int32 ByRef)+0x112*** ERROR: Module load completed but symbols could not be loaded for C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian\SourceTree\SourceTree.exe

0a 000000d2`6e8fd9c0 00007ff8`5dc768d0 EncodingTools!href.Utils.EncodingTools.DetectInputCodepages(Byte[], Int32)+0x1d5*** WARNING: Unable to verify checksum for EncodingTools.dll
*** ERROR: Module load completed but symbols could not be loaded for EncodingTools.dll

fields.description:
When in the "Working Files" section of a Git tab:

Set viewing settings to "Pending Files, sorted by path"  and "tree view"
Open branches below the 1 level children of the root
Click a pending file to stage it.
The tree in the unstaged area will reset any open branches to closed.
fields.summary: Unstaged tree view resets open branches when file is checked

fields.description:
The error message says STASH instead of bitbucket

see attached
fields.summary: Error Message still says STASH instead of BitBucket

fields.description: In the screenshot, I have two files that are modified which I need to commit. When I try to commit the files, they never appear in the screen to allow me to check them for commit. This does not allow me to commit them at all. I have seen that this happens very frequently. Also as another variation, sometimes the modified files are not detected as well. Closing out Sourcetree and reopening fixes the issue most of the times.
fields.summary: Sourcetree for windows does not display the files modified for commit

fields.description:
I did re-install windows and when adding a previously created workspace SourceTree just closes.
The log shows that the issue is a file permission setup issue for the ,gitattributes file, see attached sourcetree.log.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when I open a new existing workspace with permission setup issues
The number lines of "Blame selected..." only support 3 digits.
Would be useful to can do a search in the text of "Blame Selected..."

fields.description:
The order of branches in the Branches tree changes often, and isn't consistent; for example, switching branches can cause the list to change order.

Please make it so the branch list is sorted predictably.
It would be even better if the sort could put branch folders at the top of the view (by branch folders, I mean folders in the tree that result from branches named like "folder-part/branch-part")
fields.summary: Branch list sorting

fields.description:
Search view has this extra pane that will show you the affected files once you select a commit from the commit list.  Please update the log view to also have this pane.

See attached pics.
fields.summary: Improve log view to show commit affected file list pane

fields.description:
SourceTree Win deletes http.proxy entry in %home%\.gitconfig every time its Options dialog is closed.

Given an http.proxy entry in %home%\.gitconfig, then:
1.- Execute SourceTree Win.
2.- Exceute Tools > Options.
3.- Close Options window.

The result: the http.proxy entry in %home%\.gitconfig disappears. Any other entry (like https.proxy) is unaffected.

As a sidenote, I have a custom proxy configured in SourceTree.
fields.summary: SourceTree Win deletes http.proxy entry in %home%\.gitconfig

fields.description: Changing the "Push branches" setting in the Git tab has no effect. It always resets to "matching"
fields.summary: "Push branches" setting not saved

fields.description:
- Create a bookmarked repository. It appears in the pane on the left.
- Create another bookmarked repository. It appears in the pane on the left below the first one.
- In the pane on the left, drag the second repository to reorder it above the first one.
- The dragged repository disappears from the pane on the left instead of being reordered.

Note that dragging the first one to reorder it below the second works.
fields.summary: Reordering bookmarked repository to top removes it

fields.description: It would be nice if you could specify for the cloned folder name to derive from the branch name (minus "feature" and/or "hotfix").  It currently defaults to "root".
fields.summary: Add option for default project folder name to be branch name

fields.description:
It is possible to set a single Projects folder under MISC in the Options Menu.

h1. Folders pr. Account or Account+Team/Project/Org

As an idea, it would be nice if it was possible to set or override that folder on a per account basis, so one could have a structure as:

P:\Github\... -> For projects from Github
P:\Bitbucket\... -> For projects from Bitbucket
D:\Work\... -> For work projects that could be in E.g. Bitbucket server.

This could go even further and take Github -> Organisation and Bitbucket -> Project/Team etc. into account for suggesting a folder.

Often there is a difference in the projects nature and relation in your daily work depending on where it's stored, e.g. in our case github/bitbucket projects are often OSS projects we use in our software and therefore sometimes contribute to, while having our local projects in a local instance of Bitbucket server. So separation of these on the disk as well would be really nice...

h1. Alternative: Folders based on Bookmark folders

Another, and perhaps easier way to implement a better management of this is to allow the Bookmark folder be reflected in the path under the Main projects folder.

So e.g.:

Project folder: "P:\Projects"
Bookmark folder: "Bitbucket / PrivateProjects"
Target: "P:\Projects\Bitbucket\PrivateProjects"

To put that further, a second iteration could allow configuration of root target of any given bookmark folder, so given the following bookmark structure:

Default Project folder: "P:\Projects"
* Github -> #Inherit => "P:\Projects\Github"
** Public -> #Inherit => "P:\Projects\Github\Public"
** Private -> #Inherit => "P:\Projects\Github\Private"
* Bitbucket -> #Inherit => "P:\Projects\Bitbucket"
** Public -> #Inherit => "P:\Projects\Bitbucket\Public"
** Private -> #Inherit => "P:\Projects\Bitbucket\Private"
* Work -> #Custom(D:\MyWork) => "D:\MyWork"
** Team -> #Inherit => "D:\MyWork\Team"
*** SolutionA -> #Inherit => "D:\MyWork\Team\SolutionA"
*** SolutionB -> #Custom(D:\SolutionB) => "D:\SolutionB"
**** Child -> #Inherit => "D:\SolutionB\Child"
** Shared -> #Inherit => "D:\MyWork\Shared"

Hope that makes sense. >.<

*Caveats*

If bookmark folders are used, when the user moves projects between different projects, what should happen?...
* a) Move the files to the new location based on what the new computed path would be (This would fuck with IDE's etc. :(  )
* b) Leave the files in place, only the initial clone will ever determine the location on the disk. (Likely better, this is how it is today, bookmark folders would ever only be helping during initial cloning)
* c) Prompt the user for the action to take. (More complex, and again if the user chooses to move then there is a swarm of follow up tasks for him/her, that is ofc. not SourceTree's concern)
** If C, because promts are annoying, a configuration could be added to: "When moving bookmarks: -> Move Files, Leave Files, Promt"
fields.summary: Granular Project folder Management

fields.description:
If the option of "Use System Mercurial" is enabled, and you have version 3.7.1 (or possible later version) then trying to, for instance, start a new Release produces the following error:

{{hg flow -y release start Test
0 files updated, 0 files merged, 0 files removed, 0 files unresolved
flow: error: Hg command failed: hg update develop 
flow: error: abort: 'dict' object has no attribute 'active'}}

With previous versions of Mercurial it worked fine, and using the "embedded version" works fine too.
fields.summary: Impossible to use Hg Flow with System Mercurial 3.7.1: error 'dict' object has no attribute 'active'

fields.description:
Wouldnt it be great to select multiple hunks and them stage them all at once?

I often have a file with various changes and everytime I stage hunk something it reloads the hole file, when all I want is to stage N hunks (but not all). 

So I could "tick" the chunks I want to stage and dont worry about "chunk this one, reload the whole file, stage this one" etc.
fields.summary: Stage multiple hunks at once

fields.description:
I had started a pull operation and SourceTree noticed that there was a rebase in progress.  I elected to abort the rebase and SourceTree crashed.

Please see attached logs.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when aborting rebase

fields.description: Add support for VSTS Git en dropdown (See attachment) or clarify how to use *Unknown* for that purpose.
fields.summary: Support Pull Request for VSTS GIT (Visual Studio Team Services)

fields.description: The SourceTree allows to check remotes for updates. It works well. But after I started the application I need to wait the time,which is set as period for the check, for the first check. I would expect that the first check is done immediatelly after start of SourceTree and then continues with set interval.
fields.summary: Check default remotes

fields.description: It would be very nice to have a 50 and 72 character guideline at the commit message editbox, to wrap the text as per Git recommendation. It could be more abstract eg. number of guidelines and character width in application settings
fields.summary: Add guidelines to commit message editor

fields.description:
This does seem to happen after doing a pull/push.

After attempting to switch branch, and the error message showing, when I watch the .git folder the index.lock file is repeatedly added and removed and so the ability to then switch branch without first closing sourcetree depends on timing.

Before the error message is shown for the first time, there is no index.lock file.

The problem exists both when the "Use Embedded Git" and "Use System Git" options are selected. The embedded git version is 2.6.1.
fields.summary: "fatal: Unable to create 'E:/Projects/thor-git/.git/index.lock': File exists" when switching branch

fields.description: When trying to use the Copy Path to Clipboard, SourceTree crashes. See screenshots and attached log for details. v. 1.7.0.32509
fields.summary: Copy Path to Clipboard crashes SourceTree

fields.description:
Entries in the context menu don't work properly on the ST Win 1.7.0:
{code}
"Show in Explorer"
"Copy Path To Clipboard"
The reason is that SourceTree does not produce valid Windows paths:
C:\Users\...\git/repo\data\...
{code}
fields.summary: SourceTree generates unvalid Windows paths

fields.description:
Step by step:

# Have a working copy Git repository/project with over 1500 unstaged files
# Add the working copy into SourceTree
# The new repo tab opens
#  If it's on tree view, after some seconds, the spinner stops, the app freezes completely and never comes back.
# If it's not, switch to tree view, close the tab/SourceTree.
# After reopening SourceTree or the repo tab, after some seconds, the spinner stops, the app freezes completely and never comes back.
fields.summary: Repositories with over 1000 files will hang SourceTree without loading when Status/Commit tab is in TreeView

fields.description: The software is creating it's own error when switching branches. When switching to another branch, the software will create the index.lock file and then report an error that the file exists. There isn't any other software running that would create the Index.lock file.
fields.summary: Error loop

fields.description: Git LFS support doesn't appear to be fully working on windows: while the command line terminal client that comes with source tree supports it, the hooks don't seem to be working 100% from windows (i.e. Source tree Windows thinks that all the binary files have changes because they no-longer match the hook files)
fields.summary: Working Git-lfs support

fields.description:
As a user I would like to select source code from the diff panel and copy it to the clipboard.

Showing source code without the ability to select fells a little like an obviously missing piece of functionality.
fields.summary: Support select/copy from source code panel

fields.description:
Summary pretty much covers it.

Create a branch or two and add two (or more bookmarks).
Using SourceTree attempt to switch to a bookmark, notice that the "branch" changes but the bookmark does not become active.
drop to a cmd shell and run hg bookmarks and verify no active bookmarks.

Have to manually run hg up {bookmark} for the bookmark to become active.
fields.summary: Switching/Updating to a bookmark (i.e double-clicking it) doesn't activate it

fields.description:
Having multiple open repositories that have the same subtree (with the same name and relative path) - when you try to do an action to the subtree in any of the repositories, it may actually perform that action in one of the other repositories.

Image sequence:
http://imgur.com/a/WF8pF

Tested using Windows 7:
Image 1 - Two repositories called "Horizontal" and "Vertical" opened, both share a subtree called AMACutils.
Image 2: I perform a pull operation from the subtree in the Vertical tab.
Image 3: As you can see, it pulls correctly.
Image 4: I switch to the Horizontal tab.
Image 5: I try to perform a pull operation
Image 6: Apparently, nothing happens.
Image 7: But if I switch quickly to the Vertical tab, I can see it's pulling from the subtree there.

Every time you launch SourceTree, the first time you pull from the subtree it will be done correctly, but from that moment on, everytime you try to do it in a different repository, it will do it in the repository in which it was done the first time.
fields.summary: Sourcetree performs actions on the wrong subtree when multiple repositories are open.
i selected a revision and , in Log / History i do Ctrl + A, Ctrl + C then it crash

fields.description:
After attempting to merge automatically the program fails to correctly communicate to the user that a commit must be made. To an inexperienced user they will appear to be in a deadlock where if they push, they are told to pull, and if they pull they get an error.

The "nothing to commit" message is technically correct, and comes directly from GIT.  However, to an end user, they will appear to be in a deadlock where if they push, they are told to pull, and if they pull they get an error.

To improve GUI messaging around these instances, Sourcetree should:
1.If a merge commit is queued up in the File Status window it should never say "Nothing to commit". "Nothing to commit" is inaccurate and misleading. Additionally the text box at the bottom should be expanded by default to ensure that the user sees the commit that they must make.

2.If the user attempts to Pull when they still have a queued commit, after they receive the error message you should switch to the 'File Status' tab. That way the user will immediately see what they need to do to resolve this 'deadlock'
fields.summary: Improve messaging in GUI to work around "nothing to commit" GIT message after a merge.

fields.description:
Step one you have to open SourceTree and expand to full size window
Step two close SourceTree saving full screen settings
Step three launch SourceTree again
Step four try and move vertical divider between file list and file differences areas...

There is a vertical window divider seperating the file lists from the file contents/differences section of the window (specifially File Status and Log / History tab views).  When you launch the application (full screen) you are unable to move the seperating line left or right.  You have to first change to a view that is not expanded fully on monitor then move, then you are able to change back to full screen and adjust sizing.
fields.summary: Expanding "File Status" and "Log / History" tab does not work when first opening SourceTree

fields.description:

Exact same error with 1.7.0. I used chocalatey to get 1.6.25 and everything was perfect. So this is a genuine issue.

Can't access to gitlab repo

fields.description:
I cloned a repo through bitbucket's "Clone in SourceTree" button. While It was downloading (I had set the location and pressed "Clone"), while the bar was empty, I started cloning another repository, also through bitbucket's "Clone in SourceTree". The 1st cloning completed, but I couldn't close the modal window, as I had to designate the cloning location of the second repo. I pressed clone for the new repo, and after it opened the new modal, SourceTree crashed.

I haven't tried to reproduce it, and I doubt that I would be able to (it seems rare).
fields.summary: Crash on Cloning
Shopping Cart

fields.description:
When searching for certain commits by the commit message, the search is done across all branches. This is not really useful, since the result are very polluted and disorganized if the search matches commits across multiple branches (e.g. merges between branches are also included).

It would be great if we could filter the search to only the current branch *or* if a small label was displayed along with each result, representing on which branch this commit is.
fields.summary: Searching commits (filter by branch)

fields.description:
While evaluating BitBucket Server and Bamboo hosted on the same server, each had to be setup with an extra context path \[[1|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/KB/Integrating+Apache+HTTP+Server+reverse+proxy+with+Bitbucket+Server]\] \[[2|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/integrating-bamboo-with-apache-http-server-391087370.html]\] to avoid the problems with JSESSIONID cookie name not being unique, causing the user to be constantly logged out of each application \[[3|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMKB/Constantly+logged+out+of+Bamboo]\]. It appears that even with the context path, SourceTree is unable to authenticate to BitBucket Server as a hosted account unless the user enables the setting to save their password. 

I submitted a support ticket (STSP-294) and submitting this improvement request was the only offered recourse.
fields.summary: Support BitBucket Server with context path as Hosted Account without having to save password

fields.description:
There's info here on how to backport specific commits within this guide:
https://medium.com/@porteneuve/mastering-git-subtrees-943d29a798ec#.bzdfjhq08

This would be extremely helpful for future work.
fields.summary: Cherry pick commits to backport to subtree's remote

fields.description:
A 'Compact View' option for toolbar icons for people who want less layout space & smaller icons. 

The current icon toolbar occupies too much space, leaving about 2/3 of the window to Working tree, diff.. 

Also reducing the padding in the tab pages would be a plus. 
 !image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: A 'Compact View' option for toolbar icons

fields.description:
This is for version 1.7.0.32509 which does not seem to be supported ????

1. Did some changes under Develop branch
2. Stash them
3. Using GITFlow opened feature XYZ
4. Applied stash to feature XYZ for more testing and development
5. Needed to switch to Develop branch (but did not commit changes)
6. SourceTree *does not* inform of need to commit before switch
7. Working copy is changed to Develop (bold font) but all uncommitted changes from feature XYZ are kept as checked through file status. Checking with Visual studio also shows feature XYZ changes. 

It seems Develop was not checked out, even tough current branch (in bold) is shown to be develop.
fields.summary: Using GITFlow, switching from Feature to Develop branch not working.

fields.description:
The de-facto standard for selecting files in a list is that any time a single click is done on a file without modifiers (no CTRL or SHIFT) all the other files should be de-selected.

In Sourcetree if multiple files are already selected (see attached screenshot) and a single click is performed on one of them nothing happens. To obtain the correct result the user has to
- CTRL + click a file so that the single file is de-selected
- Click again on the same file so that all the other files get de-selected

I don't see a situation where this is beneficial, if it's an intended feature please ignore.
fields.summary: Non standard behavior for file selection in unstaged / staged areas

fields.description:
h3. resume

when cloning 2 repos at the same time, when the 2nd finishes, source tree raises an error. Sourcetree.log is attached.

SourceTree 1.7.0.32509 for windows 7, 64 bits is used.

h3. steps to reproduce

# open source tree
# clone a repo by pressing the button "clone in sourcetree" from stash
# edit sourcetree clone options and start the clone process
# clone another repo by pressing the button "clone in sourcetree" from stash
# edit sourcetree clone options and start the clone process (5 sourcetree windows will be opened: sourcetree main window, 1st clone options, 1st clone process log, 2nd clone options, 2nd clone process log)
# 1st clone process ends (I can see miniature in windows taskbar with green bars)
#* expected: I'm able to close 1st clone window
#* actual: I'm not able to focus 1st clone window
# 2nd clone process ends
#* expected: 2nd clone windows is shown and I'm able to close it
#* actual: error is raised and report bug window is shown

h3. workaround

do not clone a repo while another is being cloned

h3. how to fix - idea

block the ability to clone during a clone process
fields.summary: Error when cloning 2 repos at the same time

fields.description:
I like assigning repos to Projects and giving them different avatars.

In the SourceTree application, I'd like the repo list on the left to have collapsible folders based upon the Project the repo(s) is assigned to.
fields.summary: Add Folder Structure in Repo browser based on Project

fields.description:
SourceTree 1.7.0.32509
My repo is hosted in bitbucket, I was writing my commit message and SourceTree crashed, I t happened 3 times this morning.
fields.summary: Crash when entering commit message

fields.description:
This has been an issue for me for well over a year now, I just now decided to make an issue about it.

1. I set my remote branch (upstream/DevTest - a private repo): http://i.imgur.com/3i74gHi.png
2. I Pull to update everything. Make changes, then commit them while using the "Create Pull Request" drop-down menu option and have it point to origin/DevTest (my own repo).
3. The commit and PR works fine, but the tracked remote branch changes from upstream to origin until I change it back again.
4. Repeat.

This is how the best Git'ers do it, right? Push to origin, then PR the change over to upstream? Am I doing something uncommon that has Sourcetree trying to correct me?

P.S. There's no "Affects Versions" create issue option for v1.7.
fields.summary: The tracked remote branch changes after committing

fields.description:
SourceTree is continually spinning, and constantly not refreshing with what I select. I cannot view the files within a repo, or commit new code.

Git version is 1.9.5
8GB Ram; 2.30 GHz; 115 GB
SourceTree 1.6.14.0
Windows 7 Enterprise SP 1
fields.summary: Sourcetree keeps spinning

fields.description:
When attempting to create a pull request via the context menu sourcetree crashes.
Looking at the error file attached it appears to be related to trying to access gravatar.com which is blocked by our corporate network.
When using the drop down menu it appears to go further but does not actually create the pull request.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes when trying to create pull request

fields.description: See title
fields.summary: Terminal doesn't open, when working copy path ends with slash

fields.description:
java version "1.8.0_66"
SourceTree 1.7.0.32509

Using SourceTree NOT as Windows administrator
fields.summary: Every time i select a (git) tab (project, File Status, Log/History, ..) the screen freezes

fields.description:
Right click on local Git branch and click create pull request when repo is connected to Git hub.  It's also worth noting that I have several stash repos which require a VPN to connect.  I was not connected over the VPN at the time.

Attached log showing stack traces.
fields.summary: Crash when creating pull request for github repo

fields.description: Check the attached image
fields.summary: Source code view can not be scrolled horiontally if you do not scroll to bottom first
pull request not working

fields.description:
On BitBucket, non-conflicted merge commits are grayed-out and conflicted merges are colored yellow. In TortoiseGit, it's possible to hide merges in the log. 

It would be nice if there was a way to customize the display of merge commits in SourceTree somehow. Ideally, I'd like to be able to hide the non-conflicted merge commits and highlight the conflicted merge commits, but maybe there's an even better way to visualize this?
fields.summary: Hide merge commits

fields.description: When you try to create a branch from a commit, in the GUI, no matter which commit you select before pressing OK, it always enters the latest commit in to the text box.
fields.summary: Create branch from specified commit doesn't work correctly.

fields.description:
Gitflow window does not support bugfix branch 

This is recently added to AVH version (Ref: [https://github.com/petervanderdoes/gitflow-avh])

NOTE: hotfix branch is branched off from master while bugfix branch is branched off from develop according to the Gitflow.

!image-2016-01-22-10-42-41-282.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: SourceTree Gitflow does not show bugfix branch

fields.description:
I use the crap out of Windows 10's virtual desktop feature.  I may be working on a couple of projects at a time, and I typically put each on its own virtual desktop.  With Git Extensions, I can have a separate copy of the app running on each virtual desktop, each pointed at the repo I'm using in that context.  

It doesn't seem that SourceTree supports that.  When I try to launch SourceTree from a different virtual desktop than it is already running on, it just brings me back to the already-running instance.  That's not what I want.  I want it to spin up a new copy.

Please make SourceTree support this behavior.
fields.summary: Support Windows 10 Virtual Desktops

fields.description:
Please see the attachment.

The error pop-up with Git messages blocks almost the whole interface,
it's a widely used UI technique to allow users discarding popups or modals with Escape button.

I really like the hotkey mapping in SourceTree, apart from that point.

Please, allow us to close the message with Escape button.

Related stories:
SRCTREEWIN-417, SRCTREEWIN-2068, SRCTREE-3318

While comment on SRCTREEWIN-1023 explains the behavior, this particular error with .lock file is always showing Full Output for me in SourceTree for Windows 1.7.0.32509
fields.summary: Allow using Esc as a hotkey for closing error messages
Deploy AWS Direct Access Services

fields.description: Currently, dates in ST are hardcoded as "d MMM yyyy H:mm".  It would be a nice feature to have ST respect whatever is set in the system defaults within windows.
fields.summary: Allow Sourcetree to use system default time configuration for log file viewer.

fields.description:
Fetching using Windows 10 will not complete, and sit without any errors.  Running direct from terminal shows:
====
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch upstream
The server's host key is not cached in the registry. You
have no guarantee that the server is the computer you
think it is.
The server's rsa2 key fingerprint is:
ssh-rsa 2048 97:8c:1b:f2:6f:14:6b:5c:3b:ec:aa:46:46:74:7c:40
Do you want to accept this server's key and retry the operation ?
====

Accepting, and then going back in to ST to re try will now work.  Either the alert dialogue box is not triggering, or one needs to be added.  Using putty to load SSH keys.
fields.summary: Windows 10 - alert dialogue box does not exist for server host key caching.

fields.description:
SourceTree does not update the total number of available pulls for quite sometime after you get the window into view.

e.g minimise SourceTree, someone else commits and pushes changes, you go back to the window.. it says nothing to pull. You then try to commit and it errors because you need to pull... now suddenly it says pulls are available.

It should be updating the available pulls and working copy changes in the background.
fields.summary: Working Copy & Pulls don't update until SoureTree is in view

fields.description: Usually when preparing for a commit I work through the files, staging them and writing comments about the changes in those files. If I have to stop before I am finished and have to exit SourceTree, the comments I have made so far are not remembered and so when I come back I have to start all over again. It would be good if the comments were remembered on exit.
fields.summary: Commit comment not saved on exit

fields.description: Please add a vertical scrollbar to the Options. I cannot access the OK button at the bottom since it is not accessible in my screen resolution. Dragging the window doesn't help as its size is larger than the screen.
fields.summary: Dialog not completely visible with some screen resolutions
